alert.note: Alert for Madison (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 4:20PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Madison County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 AM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM to 10 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute today. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of locally heavy snow will move into the New York Thruway corridor, including Utica and Syracuse, this evening. The time of arrival will be very close to the end of the evening commute, though commuters heading north of the Thruway will be more likely to run into inclement weather.
info.instruction: The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org, or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
